reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Investing for impact against Tuberculosis and HIV

description.narrative: South Africa - TB/HIV - National Department of Health of the Republic of South Africa - NDOH. This program has the following goals: Accelerate prevention to reduce new HIV and TB infections and STIs. Reduce morbidity and mortality by providing treatment, care and adherence support for all. Reach all key and vulnerable populations with customised and targeted interventions. Address the social and structural drivers of HIV, TB and STIs, and lin these effort to the National Development Plan. Ground the response to HIV, TB and STIs in human rights principles and approaches. Promote leadership and shared accountability for sustainable response to HIV, TB and STIs. Mobilise resources and maximise efficiencies to support the achievment of NSP goals and ensure a sustainable approach. Strengthen strategic information to drive progress towards achievement of NSP goals. The objectives of this program are: 1.1 Reduce new HIV infections to less than 100,000 by 2022 through combination prevention interventions. 2.1 Implement the 90-90-90 strategy for HIV. 2.2 Implement the 90-90-90 Strategy for TB. 3.1 Increase engagment, collaboration and advocacy of key and vulnerable populations in the development and implementation of social and health support activities. 3.2 To provide an enabling environment to increase access to health services by key and vulnerable populations. 4.1 Implement social and behaviour change programmes to address key drivers of the epidemic and build social cohesion. 4.4 Implement and scale up a package of harm reduction interventions for harmful use of alcohol and drugs in all districts. 4.5 Implement economic strengthening programmes with a focus on youth in priority focus districts. 5.3 Promote an environment that enables and protects human and legal rights and prevents stigma and discrimination. 6.1 Strengthen AIDS Councils to provide effective co-ordination and leadership of all stakeholders for shared accountability in the implementation of the NSP. 7.1 Improve efficiency and mobilise sufficient resources to achieve the goals, objective and targets of the NSP. 8.1 Optimise routinely collected strategic health information for data utilisation in decision making

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for ZAF-C-NDOH
Number of children <5 in contact with TB patients who began isonizide preventive therapy
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Impact indicator for ZAF-C-NDOH
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
HIV incidence among 15-49 age group
Percentage of other vulnerable populations (specify) who are living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for ZAF-C-NDOH
HIV O-other 2: Percentage of young men and women aged 15-24 who had sexual intercourse before age 15 (age of sexual debut)
YP O-Other 2: Delivery in age 10-19 in facility rate
Percentage of other vulnerable populations who report the use of a condom at last sexual intercourse
Percentage of people living with HIV who report experiences of HIV-related discrimination in health-care settings
YP O-Other 1: Percentage of adolescent girls (15-19) who have age disparate relationships
HIV O-other 4: Composite Index for Internalized Stigma
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
HIV O-other 1: Percentage of men and women aged 15 - 24 who report the use of a condom at last sexual intercourse

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of people who inject drugs reporting the use of sterile injecting equipment the last time they injected
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
HIV O-other 3: Percentage of adults viral load suppressed 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of (estimated) people living with HIV who have been tested HIV-positive
